MS MCQs

    Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines - What is configuration as code?

    »

    1. How does configuration as code differ from infrastructure as code?

      They both refer to the same concept.

      Infrastructure as code uses imperative code. Configuration as code uses declarative code.

      Infrastructure as code refers to the automated provisioning of infrastructure. Configuration as code refers to automating how software is configured within your infrastructure.


    2. A co-worker manually installs a security patch on some, but not all, of the web servers in your deployment. This is likely an example of:

      Configuration drift

      Configuration management

      Idempotency


    3. Which of the following is an example of a node?

      A virtual machine in your network that runs payment processing software.

      The central configuration server that holds your configuration code.
